captions.text:
I got arrested
for two burglaries

I had committed to pay for
my addiction to heroin,

and I ended up spending five
years in the Arizona state
prison system.

And I hadn't even been
out for a few days,

and I'd started drinking
and smoking pot again.

And soon enough I
got into trouble,
and they sent me back in.

And it became important for me
to figure out where I was going

and what I was
doing with my life.

I started to believe that
God was trying to help me

because I had these unmistakable
feelings that were like God was

reaching out, but I
couldn't understand why.

And I finally got
down on my knees,

and it was the first
time that I had

prayed with any real sincerity
in probably 11, 12 years.

And I said, "God, I
believe that You're there,

and I believe that
You're trying to help me.
What I don't understand is why.
Why would You want to help me?

I'm a convict, I'm an
addict, I'm an alcoholic,

and I haven't tried
to follow You.
Why would You want to help me?"

I got an answer to that
prayer in a feeling

I had in here and
words that I actually

heard: "Mark, it's
because I love you."

I dated this girl--I was at
BYU--for five or six months.

And the day I asked
her to marry me

was the day she decided
to break up with me.

And I had a dentist's
appointment that week,
and they did a root canal.

And the dentist gave me a
prescription for pain pills,

and immediately I had a
warning bell go off in my head.

Before I'd even gone and
gotten a refill of it,

I had reversed the
prescription and I

was taking four to six
every one to two hours.

And not only did
I relapse again;

I ended up living on the streets
and getting into the worst

addiction I've ever
been involved with.
I got involved with a robbery.

When I went in, I told this guy,
"Hey, I just want your money.
I'm not going to hurt you."

I just kept my hand in
my pocket, and I left.

Hiding in the bushes
down the road,

watching the cop
cars go by and stuff,

I realized what an absolute
phony and fraud and hypocrite I
was.

I saw this fellow's
reaction in my mind's eye,

and that look of fear
that was in his eyes;

how could I have done that
to another human being?

I felt like I was about the
biggest failure on the earth

because God had saved
my life once before
and I had thrown it away.

I figured out how to get the
safety off the gun and a bullet

into the chamber, and all
the sudden the whole world

went silent; the
sirens going by,

the cars, everything else
just totally went silent.

And I heard these
words: "I'm still here."
And I said, "How can You be?

After all I've done, after
all You've done for me,
how can You still be there?"
But I knew whose voice it was.
And I knew that it was real.

I finally walked
out of those bushes

and to the cops that
were out on the street.

I walked up to them
and I said, "I'm
the one you're looking for."

I ended up spending nine
years in the prison system.

But you know, nine
years was a small price

to pay to have a life
given back to me again,

because I came to find a
loving God who had been with me

every step of the
way, and the times

that I didn't think
He was there were
only because I wasn't looking.

I was able to get out of
prison about 16 years ago now.
There is a woman I met.

We're just about ready to
celebrate our 15th wedding

anniversary, and our
son, who we named Ammon,

was born on Christmas
morning seven years ago.

[VOICE OF ELDER CARDON]
The Lord knows what

we are facing, that
we all sin and "come

short of the glory of
God" again and again.

He "knoweth the
weakness of man and how
to succor them who are tempted."

He teaches us to
"pray always that [we]
enter not into temptation."

We are told to "cry
unto him for mercy;
for he is mighty to save."

He commands us to
repent and to forgive.

And although
repentance is not easy,

as we strive with all our
hearts to obey His gospel,

He gives this
promise: "Verily I say

unto you, notwithstanding
[your] sins,

my bowels are filled with
compassion towards [you].

I will not utterly cast you
off; and in the day of wrath
I will remember mercy."
The Savior wants to forgive.

comments.author: Kelly Miller

comments.text:
The Elder at the end reminded us of the Key to making this a reality. "Pray 
always that ye enter not in to temptation."  I know how you feel man, and 
whenever I slack on praying ALL THE TIME, I always find myself back in the 
pit of pornography.  I had to realize that I literally cannot change by my 
own willpower, and prayer is just the beginning. Find a recovery program, 
find a friend, and find your life again!  one more thing, tell yourself 
that You CAN be this man.  If we continually change our mindset to truly 
believe that we can overcome, then we will slowly make the correct 
decisions to lead us in the right direction. God Bless!
comments.author: SK0Ot3r1

comments.text:
ijij123, you need to get someone you trust to work out a plan to help you 
overcome this addiction and soon. also check out the church website about 
addictions. overcomingpornography.org  make sure that the person/people 
helping you are not ones who share your problem. there most likely will not 
be one quick fix,  it will be hard,  it will take time. but never give up 
hope that you can overcome this.

comments.text:
1. I love the 12 step program which is run by couple missionaries called to 
do that.  We have it at churches all over and there is a wonderful book!  
2. In His Image by Steven A. Cramer to become enthralled with the majesty 
of the human body,
3.  read pg 103 in Visions of Glory- it will terrify you as well as open 
your eyes to know what is going on on a spiritual level- and of the power 
that overcomes you and of the reality of needing a Savior.  It tells of a 
good and decent man (like you) with a sweet wife and children sleeping in 
the house. 
4. See your bishop
5. Read the Book of Mormon EVERY DAY
comments.author: Kelly Miller

comments.text:
Your willingness to change is going to be the foundation. The key is to not 
give up your hope and faith that Christ can help you overcome your 
addiction. It will seem impossible, even undesirable, but if you stay close 
to the Lord through prayer and study, maintaining your faith in his ability 
to heal you, he will do so. Find a friend or leader to call whenever 
temptation attacks you. Set up all the lines of defense you can against the 
filth of the world. Above all, maintain your faith, and realize that all 
the Lord expects is your very best, and he will do the best. That light you 
are looking for will grow brighter and brighter, until it swallows up your 
guilt and you are left as a man made strong by trial. In that way, the Lord 
can and will make you guidance for others who will suffer your same trials. 
May God bless and strengthen you.
comments.author: Spencer Christensen

comments.text:
Have you gone to an ARP group? You need to if you haven't. Visit arp.lds.org 
for an overview and to find a local meeting.
It also helps to learn to understand what pornography does to your brain. 
Check out candeocan.com, a program that really explains what's going on in 
our brain, against the backdrop of Christian principles.

comments.text:
Before I go into detail on how you can find peace and eternal happiness in 
your life I'd just like to share that I am not perfect... No servant of our 
heavenly father is except his beloved son... however though I may not be 
perfect I know these things which I shall share with you are true and 
testify to you that I cannot claim these truths to be mine for they are our 
saviors and I am but a messenger...Reaching out to YouTube has been a 
valiant decision but the main person who is willing to hear your questions 
and awaits to comfort you is our loving heavenly father... the reason you 
keep falling into sin is because you continuously give into the temptations 
of the devil... the only way to loose the band's of wickedness is to desire 
more your eternal salvation than your temporal pleasure and through that a 
change of heart and the Lord's light with be flooded upon insomuch that 
your heart will cry with joy... this pathway will not be easy and just 
because you receive revaluation doesn't mean it'll become any easier for we 
know that to enter the house of the Lord it is a difficult and many will 
choose the easier path and be lost in this life and the next... I testify 
unto you to repent whole heartedly that and consistently that the Lord may 
know that not only are you willing to change but are will to work for your 
salvation... through Christ all things are possible and I'm so grateful for 
the gift of forgiveness for I fall every single day... I bear witness that 
through your diligence and faitusefulness he will save you and bring peace 
and happiness.... I hope that through me the Lord has helped you(: And I 
hope you may overcome all your weaknesses and worldly desires... safe 
travels

comments.text:
"Savior's ability and willingness to forgive him again and again, even when 
he felt undeserving" I am not sure what is meant in this context  " 
undeserving"  because part of the addiction process is to either feel we 
deserve what we" get" or we wouldn't be addicted, or that we  "deserve" our 
addiction, and look at it as a punishment for exercising ...our agency.... 
I made wrong choices in  my youth, in ignorance and while under unrighteous 
dominion-  does our Savior deserve to  punish me because my action is 
considered to be in "open rebellion" against God the Father ? I understand 
that this seems to be a bit of a  conundrum...but please bear in mind that 
I am a covert to the church and (not to make excuses) didn't know about the 
WOW until I joined the church as an adult.- I hope I'm making some sense, 
because I sincerely need help in understanding this quote-thank you sisters 
and brothers!﻿
comments.author: Helene Anon

The SAVIOR is always here, til man stops using faith to do the work that it 
takes to ruse above our failures, which are only lesson to iinstruct us. 
These lessons are a great blessing, a gift from the Father through the 
SAVIOR. We go thought this stuff to give us knowledge to operate in the 
Celestial Kingdom when we get there. The Father loves us very much and so 
does the SAVIOR. You are of great worth. Draw around you, or create a 
recovery team that works for you. I found mine at Pathways in Cuba Mo. You 
are loved. And you can recover too. All around you is full of filthy 
wickedness, because you are strong and of great worth. The darkness does 
not want you to succeed, but, you will. No matter what or how the darkness 
tempts you. ﻿

YOU ARE OF GREAT WORTH.
And when you succeed, your success strengthens others. 
Tell your story.

The Savior did not only atone for our sin, He has also atoned for our 
struggles, our sorrows, our fears, and our pains; Mentally, physically, 
emotionally, and spiritually. It is a blessing to know that He Himself has 
felt my pain, my sorrow, my fear, and my struggles. The Savior is the 
manifestation of Heavenly Fathers love, I love my Father in Heaven, I love 
my elder brother Jesus Christ, and I love the Holy Spirit. I wish to spread 
this message to all of God's children, He loves us all.﻿

We had a great Stake Conference today. Elder Cardon was the visiting 
authority. As he spoke I remembered his last address from General 
Conference April 2013. After we came home I saw this inspiring video based 
on his remarks last April. The video is inspiring, but the talk is also 
worth reading in full. 

https://www.lds.org/general-conference/2013/04/the-savior-wants-to-forgive?lang=eng
﻿

comments.author: Bryan Bennion

comments.text:
I made some mistakes in my life a while back, which isn't a huge surprise, 
right? But I kept going back and committing the same sin, the same mistake, 
and it was through the Savior that I did return. I no longer do it, and few 
people know what it was. But Jesus was there the whole time, holding my 
hand, telling me it was going to be alright, because my mistakes were 
already atoned for. I just needed to repent. 

 Question: Is there a weight on your back that you just can't get rid of? 
The Savior knows what that feels like. He is the only one who knows your 
exact feelings, because he felt them, on a down to earth level. He will 
welcome you with open arms, no matter what you've done, no matter what 
you're doing, because he loves you. You are his younger sibling. He cares, 
I promise it. He cares and loves you. And he doesn't judge you for who you 
are or what you've done. He loves you because you are Heavenly Father's 
child, and in his eyes, that is enough. ﻿
comments.author: Margaret Crowley

comments.text: +Bill Polhemus  You are very welcome ^^ I'm glad it could reach someone.
comments.author: Margaret Crowley

comments.text: Thanks. I needed that.
comments.author: Bill Polhemus

comments.text:
I made some mistakes in my life a while back, which isn't a huge surprise, 
right? But I kept going back and committing the same sin, the same mistake, 
and it was through the Savior that I did return. I no longer do it, and few 
people know what it was. But Jesus was there the whole time, holding my 
hand, telling me it was going to be alright, because my mistakes were 
already atoned for. I just needed to repent. 

 Question: Is there a weight on your back that you just can't get rid of? 
The Savior knows what that feels like. He is the only one who knows your 
exact feelings, because he felt them, on a down to earth level. He will 
welcome you with open arms, no matter what you've done, no matter what 
you're doing, because he loves you. You are his younger sibling. He cares, 
I promise it. He cares and loves you. And he doesn't judge you for who you 
are or what you've done. He loves you because you are Heavenly Father's 
child, and in his eyes, that is enough. ﻿
comments.author: Margaret Crowley

comments.text:
I love these accounts. They prove that the saints have various backgrounds 
and many overcome REAL sorrows and sins through faith in Christ. "I say 
unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that 
repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no 
repentance."﻿
comments.author: Sarah Mansfield

comments.text: thanks...i really needed this today :)﻿

comments.text:
Wow... I am just speechless... it is a good speechless, but, wow. just 
proves that god loves us no matter what we do. and even though god may be 
disappointed with what we decided, he still loves us, and cares for us.
